An example Squiffy story for my students.

http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ofqixpckckoeanb_fi5tgw/jimmys-bad-day

Posts.EditableText: Well, the game certainly seems to offer some real choice, but it all feels kind of arbitrary and pointless. Then again, that's often the case with demonstration games. What were you aiming for?
Posts.HTML: Well, the game certainly seems to offer some real choice, but it all feels kind of arbitrary and pointless. Then again, that's often the case with demonstration games. What were you aiming for?

@felixp7
That's all, really. It was a demonstration for my students and I wanted an easy way for them to access the story so they could see how interactive fiction works. I'll be teaching them the basics of Squiffy (and some simple html) this week.

The story itself was meant to be short but amusing, and to show them how the story can branch into many different endings. I knocked it out quick in one afternoon.
